channel.title: Projects on barland.net
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on barland.net

item.title: AWS Fraud Detection
item.description: Background This project describes how Amazon S3, Amazon SageMaker and Amazon QuickSight can be utilized for Fraud Detection. Why Fraud? In 2021, credit card fraud grew to the largest ever, with 393,207 reports of credit card fraud filed. This poses a major risk for lenders and borrowers alike, and cloud based analytics are a great solution to uncover this problem. Dataset https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/kartik2112/fraud-detection This is a simulated credit card transaction dataset containing legitimate and fraud transactions from the duration 1st Jan 2019 - 31st Dec 2020.

item.title: Cats vs. Dogs Image Classifier
item.description: Introduction In this project, I will be answering the most pressing question of our generation: How do we distinguish between images of cats and dogs? In all seriousness, this is a great problem to explore the potential of deep learning and specifically, transfer learning on a simple task of classifying between images of cats and dogs. The tools I will be using in this project are: Python Typical Data Science tools such as Pandas, Numpy, and Matplotlib Keras High level library built on top of Tensorflow for creating neural networks TensorFlow The underlying library for Keras used for deep learning computation Kaggle The competition site for this project.
